label: Symmetry Lines
description: Deterministic symmetric orderings for swapping or rotating parameters; rows are 1-based and return to start.

explanation.overview: Symmetry line sequences exploit mathematical symmetries from group theory. These include palindromic (mirror) patterns and cyclic rotations. Each sequence exhibits perfect symmetry: the second half mirrors or rotates the first half.
explanation.mechanism: Two primary symmetry types: (1) Mirror symmetry - sequences reach a midpoint then reverse back to start, creating palindromic patterns. (2) Rotational symmetry - elements shift cyclically through positions. Both create predictable, aesthetically pleasing parameter sweeps.
properties: Symmetric: Second half mirrors or rotates first half
Smooth sweeps: Elements transition gradually through positions
Dihedral group: Mirror patterns come from dihedral group D_n
Cyclic group: Rotations come from cyclic group C_n
Predictable: Users can anticipate pattern evolution
explanation.applications: Excellent for parameter crossfades and sweeps. Mirror sweeps create natural rise-and-fall envelopes. Rotations distribute emphasis evenly across tracks. Use for panning automation, filter sweeps, or visual element transitions.
references: Dihedral group D_n: Symmetries of regular n-gon
Group theory: Mathematical foundations of symmetry

source.notes: Palindromic and rotational sweeps for 6 elements; convert to 0-based indices in UI.

sequences.label: Mirror Sweep on 6
sequences.explanation: Palindromic six-element pattern. Sweeps from starting position (1,2,3,4,5,6) through increasingly inverted states, reaching full reversal (6,5,4,3,2,1) at the midpoint, then mirrors back. Creates smooth crescendo-decrescendo parameter envelopes. The 10-step cycle provides gentle, symmetric modulation.

sequences.label: Rotating Crossfade on 6
sequences.explanation: Pure cyclic rotation of six elements. Each step shifts all elements one position clockwise: (1,2,3,4,5,6) → (2,3,4,5,6,1) → ... Each element visits every position exactly once before returning. Perfect for round-robin parameter distribution or creating circular panning effects. The 6-step cycle ensures equal time at each position.
